episode_summary: Live from the Cheltenham Literature Festival with guest Rachel Parris, the team discuss an 18th-century baboon prank that led to an erotic poem in the House of Lords, Japan’s miso-soup-enabled prison breaks, Tom Stoppard’s hidden Hollywood script work on Beethoven, and endangered or obsolete British crafts with cheeky job titles.

facts.fact: My fact is, in 1764, the Earl of Sandwich read a long erotic poem out in the House of Lords as revenge for a fellow MP setting a baboon on him.
My fact is that Japan's greatest ever prison escape artist escaped four times twice by using his own miso soup.
OK, my fact this week is that one of Britain's greatest living playwrights, Tom Stoppard, wrote the final draft of the movie, "Bate Hulvin."
My fact this week is, old jobs in the UK that you used to be able to do, included but-woman, baller, boner, and bottom-stainer.
